question:
UNICEF highlighted the threat posed by climate change to children. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. India is party to the Convention on the Rights of the Child.
  2. The Geneva declaration of the Rights of the Child was introduced by the UNGA.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: The Convention on the Rights of the Child was ratified by India in 1992. The convention itself was adopted in 1989. The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights was set up in line with the ratification. The convention has been ratified by 196 countries across the world. Statement 2 is incorrect: The Geneva Declaration of the Rights of the Child was introduced by the League of Nations in 1923. The document was adopted by UNGA in an extended form in 1959. The rights are being threatened by climate change according to the UNICEF.
